intro: Phebalium sediflorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its foliage is narrow and serrated, giving it a distinctive appearance. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for native pollinators.
